intro: Rubus sachalinensis var. eglandulatus, commonly known as the Sachalin raspberry, is a shrub native to the Russian Far East and parts of northeastern China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when ripe, similar to other raspberries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and for local consumption.
